metadata.title: CVE-2021-47486 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: riscv,bpf: Fix potential NULL dereference The bpf_jit_binary_free() functionrequires a non-NULL argument. When the RISC-V BPF JIT fails to converge inNR_JIT_ITERATIONS steps, jit_data->header will be NULL, which triggers aNULL dereference. Avoid this by checking the argument, prior calling thefunction.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47486` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
